name: discriminably
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
If two things are discriminably different, the difference between them can be seen, heard, or measured: discriminably different They show discriminably different behavioural patterns. At some point, an animal evolved that was discriminably distinct from a wolf.
More examplesFewer examplesWords with different meanings normally appear in discriminably different contexts.The two symptoms are discriminably different from each other.An animal obtaining a reward for a response to one stimulus will often make that response to similar but discriminably different stimuli.
